{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3749744,"name":"Sparx","username":"Sparx","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sparx/{size}/246676_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-27T16:29:53.642Z","cooked":"

Hey guys!

We are using a localization built with two MT2 cameras. We are feeding them both with gyro angle. We are now using automations on the branches of the reef and in the start of a game we reset the gyro. After like three cycles, the gyro suddenly gives a big error. It‚Äôs not a drift, it‚Äôs just in one go. Then the robot comes to the reef not in the right angle. The gyro just goes crazy in like a second and we don‚Äôt know what triggers it.

Can anyone help please?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-27T16:29:53.642Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":19.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506636,"topic_slug":"gyro-issues-with-mt2","display_username":"Sparx","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71823,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/gyro-issues-with-mt2/506636/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3749844,"name":"Carter Ryba","username":"10219Ryba","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/10219ryba/{size}/248339_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-27T20:07:53.270Z","cooked":"

Anyone who helps is gonna need your robot code. The whole thing in a GitHub repository would be preferable, it‚Äôs always the files your don‚Äôt think can cause the error that do.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-27T20:07:53.270Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506636,"topic_slug":"gyro-issues-with-mt2","display_username":"Carter Ryba","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65624,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9764, 10219"},"post_url":"/t/gyro-issues-with-mt2/506636/2","custom_user_title":"9764, 10219","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3751784,"name":"Sparx","username":"Sparx","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sparx/{size}/246676_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-29T19:04:52.920Z","cooked":"

Unfortunately, we just checked the pigeon again without our code and the same problem came up. So it‚Äôs not the problem with the code but the config with the pigeon itself‚Ä¶

Actually we tried playing with the sensitivity of the gyro and it really helped, we realized that when we span 360 degrees, there was a 6 degree error and it just kept doubling each 360 degrees spin.

The code didn‚Äôt matterüòî

So now we‚Äôre just asking if anybody else has this problem?

We did experience this. We moved the gyro closer to the center and have had no issues since. Ours was closer to 8 degrees off though.

Ive never seen this but if i had to guess it sounds like you have some form of degree offset set in the pigeons config. Maybe try factory resetting the pigeon and see if that solves it(make sure not too run any code with it before testing after the reset).

If you‚Äôre using WPILib‚Äôs pose estimator this behavior can happen if your rotational stddev is wonky. Although that doesn‚Äôt sound like this was the case based on your reply.
